content: <ce:section-title id="st020">Preparation of [Fe(bib)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(NCS)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>]<ce:inf loc="post">n</ce:inf> (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0015" view="all">A mixture of EtOH and water (1:1, 5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL) was gently layered on the top of an aqueous solution (5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL) of Fe(ClO<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·6H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (0.036<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.10<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) in a test tube. A solution of bib (0.038<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.20<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) and KNCS (0.019<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.20<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) in EtOH/H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (2:1, 6<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL) was added carefully as a third layer. Needle colorless crystals were obtained after 6<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>days. They were washed with water and dried in air. (0.037<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 67% based on Fe). Anal. calcd. (%) for C<ce:inf loc="post">22</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">24</ce:inf>FeN<ce:inf loc="post">10</ce:inf>S<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>: C 48.18, H 4.41, N 25.54; found: C 48.09, H 4.38, N 25.39. Selected IR (KBr, cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3116 (m), 2934 (m), 2858 (w), 2066 (vs), 1514 (m), 1449 (m), 1357 (w), 1280 (w), 1230 (m), 1107 (s), 1092 (s), 1029 (w), 936 (s), 839 (s), 823 (m), 759 (m), 662 (s), 628 (m).</ce:para><ce:section-title id="st025">Preparation of [Fe(bpp)(NCS)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>] (<ce:bold>2</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0020" view="all">A mixture of EtOH and water (1:1, 5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL) was gently layered on the top of an aqueous solution (5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL) of Fe(NH<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(SO<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·6H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (0.39<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 1.0<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) and KNCS (0.18<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 2.0<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) in a test tube. A solution of bpp (0.12<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.50<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) in EtOH (5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL) was added carefully as a third layer. Colorless crystals suitable for X-ray crystallography were obtained after 3<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>weeks. They were collected and washed with small amount of water and dried in air (0.32<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 79% based on Fe). Anal. calcd. (%) for C<ce:inf loc="post">15</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">20</ce:inf>FeN<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>S<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>: C, 44.56; H, 4.99; N, 20.79. Found: C, 44.43; H, 4.96; N, 20.67. IR data (cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3122 (m), 2961 (w), 2923 (m), 2062 (vs), 1545 (s), 1461 (s), 1422 (w), 1371 (s), 1319 (w), 1294 (w), 1203 (m), 1158 (w), 1126 (m), 1042(s), 1023 (m), 971 (m), 811 (s), 758 (m), 746 (m), 617 (m).</ce:para><ce:section-title id="st030">Attempted preparation of [Fe(bbd)(NCS)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>] (<ce:bold>3</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0025" view="all">The procedure was the same as that described for <ce:bold>2</ce:bold>, except that bbd (0.12<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.50<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) was used instead of bpp ligand. The reaction was carried out at room temperature and under the reflux conditions. The absence of a strong band in the infrared spectrum of reaction residue which expected around 2063<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup> for <ce:italic>ν</ce:italic>(CN) of the N-bonded thiocyanate is an evidence that no reaction was performed among the reactants.</ce:para>
clean_text:
Preparation of [Fe(bib)2(NCS)2]n (1)

A mixture of EtOH and water (1:1, 5mL) was gently layered on the top of an aqueous solution (5mL) of Fe(ClO4)2⋅6H2O (0.036g, 0.10mmol) in a test tube. A solution of bib (0.038g, 0.20mmol) and KNCS (0.019g, 0.20mmol) in EtOH/H2O (2:1, 6mL) was added carefully as a third layer. Needle colorless crystals were obtained after 6days. They were washed with water and dried in air. (0.037g, 67% based on Fe). Anal. calcd. (%) for C22H24FeN10S2: C 48.18, H 4.41, N 25.54; found: C 48.09, H 4.38, N 25.39. Selected IR (KBr, cm-1): 3116 (m), 2934 (m), 2858 (w), 2066 (vs), 1514 (m), 1449 (m), 1357 (w), 1280 (w), 1230 (m), 1107 (s), 1092 (s), 1029 (w), 936 (s), 839 (s), 823 (m), 759 (m), 662 (s), 628 (m).

Preparation of [Fe(bpp)(NCS)2] (2)

A mixture of EtOH and water (1:1, 5mL) was gently layered on the top of an aqueous solution (5mL) of Fe(NH4)2(SO4)2⋅6H2O (0.39g, 1.0mmol) and KNCS (0.18g, 2.0mmol) in a test tube. A solution of bpp (0.12g, 0.50mmol) in EtOH (5mL) was added carefully as a third layer. Colorless crystals suitable for X-ray crystallography were obtained after 3weeks. They were collected and washed with small amount of water and dried in air (0.32g, 79% based on Fe). Anal. calcd. (%) for C15H20FeN6S2: C, 44.56; H, 4.99; N, 20.79. Found: C, 44.43; H, 4.96; N, 20.67. IR data (cm-1): 3122 (m), 2961 (w), 2923 (m), 2062 (vs), 1545 (s), 1461 (s), 1422 (w), 1371 (s), 1319 (w), 1294 (w), 1203 (m), 1158 (w), 1126 (m), 1042(s), 1023 (m), 971 (m), 811 (s), 758 (m), 746 (m), 617 (m).

Attempted preparation of [Fe(bbd)(NCS)2] (3)

The procedure was the same as that described for 2, except that bbd (0.12g, 0.50mmol) was used instead of bpp ligand. The reaction was carried out at room temperature and under the reflux conditions. The absence of a strong band in the infrared spectrum of reaction residue which expected around 2063cm-1 for ν(CN) of the N-bonded thiocyanate is an evidence that no reaction was performed among the reactants.
